item.title: mkfigs
item.description: library(ggplot2) library(ggridges) ## ## Attaching package: 'ggridges' ## The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2': ## ## scale_discrete_manual library(viridis) ## Loading required package: viridisLite ggplot(diamonds, aes(x=price, y=cut, fill=factor(..quantile..))) + stat_density_ridges( color = "white", scale=4, geom = "density_ridges_gradient", calc_ecdf = TRUE, quantiles = c(0.025, 0.025), to = 8000) + scale_fill_manual(values = c("#CACC90", "#B7D3F2")) + theme_minimal() + theme(legend.position = "none") ## Picking joint bandwidth of 458

item.title: Correctness proof
item.description: Prove that given some PGoG spec, the recursive algorithm produces a correct probabilistic visualiation, where partitions proportional to specified probabilities.

item.title: R formulas
item.description: Notes for figuring out how to read/write those R formulas used in lmer, brms, etc

item.title: üìä A Probabilistic Grammar of Graphics
item.description: Turning a probability distribution into a visualization used to be difficult and even error-prone, but not anymore.

item.title: ‚ö°Ô∏è Uncertainty vizes for power grid simulations
item.description: Visualization internship with Dr. Kristi Potter at the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

item.title: üöô Your car is tracking you
item.description: Inferring geolocation from innocuous car data.

item.title: üßª Understanding preregistration
item.description: More researchers are adopting prereigstration, but are current tools serving them well?

item.title: üå≥ The garden of statistically reliable visualizations
item.description: Visual analytics tools should no longer be a garden to harvest interesting but probably unreliable patterns.

item.title: üé≠ Does Risk Theatre work?
item.description: Risk theatre is a variant of icon arrays, where we color the seat map of a theatre according to some proportion we want to communicate.

item.title: üèî Climate model ensemble similarity comparisons
item.description: SIParCS internship at the National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR). Worked with Dr. Rick Brownrigg.

item.title: üôá Physiological computing
item.description: I worked with Professor Evan Peck at Bucknell on a project about using physiological signals to improve decision-making.

item.title: ‚öóÔ∏è Mussels and hydraulic fracturing
item.description: As a freshman, I dabbled in geochemistry with Professor Carl Kirby in Geology & Environmental Geosciences at Bucknell University.

Rackham Interdisciplinary Workshop The poster I made for Dr. Audrey Michal’s talk. I am a student coordinator for this visualization workshop series at Michigan. Researchers across campus (20+ departments!) show up to our events and learn to make better visualizations. It’s a great reminder of why we study those pretty pictures. -- The poster I made for Dr. Audrey Michal’s talk. I am a student coordinator for this visualization workshop series at Michigan.
